questions.text: Capacity beyond what's required to maintain my current life is ...

answers.4: usually present — I could take on more if needed
answers.5: substantial — I have real reserve capacity
answers.3: variable — sometimes margin, sometimes maxed out
answers.1: negative — I can't keep up with current demands

questions.text: The efficiency of my systems and habits is ...

answers.4: good — I accomplish things with reasonable efficiency
answers.5: high — my systems free up significant time and energy
answers.3: moderate — some systems work, others don't
answers.1: poor — I waste huge amounts of time and energy

questions.text: Reserves of willpower and execution capacity are ...

answers.4: usually available — I have reserves most of the time
answers.5: substantial — deep wells I can draw from
answers.2: thin — barely enough for the day

questions.text: My productivity compared to others with similar time is ...

answers.4: above average — I accomplish more than most
answers.5: significantly higher — my systems multiply output
answers.2: below average — I struggle to keep up
answers.3: average — about the same as most people
answers.1: lower — I accomplish less than most

questions.text: Margin in my schedule and energy for unexpected demands is ...

answers.5: substantial — I've built in real buffer
answers.2: thin — small surprises are manageable, but barely
answers.3: moderate — I can handle some unexpected things
